description.narrative: The Prime Minister's Pacific Australia Awards (PMPA Awards) are offered to recipients of the Australian Development Scholarships (ADS) and Australian Leadership Award Scholarships (ALAS) who are leaders or potential leaders in their countries to enhance the impact of their formal studies. The aims of the Prime Minister's Pacific-Australia (PMPA) Awards are to: (1) assist nation building through strengthening institutional capacity and leadership in the Pacific and East Timor; and (2) building strong and abiding links between people in Australia and countries in the Pacific. It is expected up to 120 eligible postgraduate scholars from the Pacific will receive an Award. The Allison Sudradjat Prize is a supplementary Australia Award in honour of Ms Allison Sudradjat, an AusAID employee who died in a plane crash in 2007. Six awards are provided annually to recipients from PNG and Indonesia to enhance their education experience in Australian and their future professional careers. The total
